Comment: What about those in university? I worked part time and attended classes. Always had roommates and kept my expenses low because I was broke. My generation protested like crazy during the first gulf war. We rarely even see Gaza War protests anymore. We are watching a coup in real time, and only the old heads seem to care. I am not financially well off and the struggle is what gets me out on the streets. I also just witnessed my VETERAN father struggle to get help while he was in hospice. My Dad’s vet benefits were arriving late and he had to worry about it while he was dying! My parents lost their retirement because of my Mom’s long term illness. What is it going to take to get people on the streets? My Dad’s death was uncomfortable because he had shitty, underfunded care. Do younger people not have grandparents who are suffering? Is the hate for boomers fueling this apathy? Sorry to rant. This lack of unity is frightening and depressing. I am deeply concerned about the future of humanity, this planet, and freedom.
